title: Bob Marley
description:
Robert Nesta Marley, OM (February 6, 1945 ? May 11, 1981), better known as Bob Marley, was a Jamaican singer, songwriter, and guitarist. He is the most widely known performer of reggae music, and is famous for having popularized the genre outside Jamaica. A faithful Rastafari, Marley is regarded by many as a prophet of the religion,[1] as well as one of the greatest songwriters of all time.[2]

His best known songs are a mixture of reggae, rock, and rhythm and blues, and include \"I Shot the Sheriff\", made famous in 1974 by Eric Clapton, which raised Marley\&#039;s international profile, \"No Woman No Cry\", \"Exodus\", \"Could You Be Loved\", \"Jamming\",\"Redemption Song\" and one of his most famous songs, \"One Love\".[3] His posthumous album Legend (1984) became the best-selling reggae album ever, with sales of more than 12 million copies
